About This Game

Think fast and hang on to your ride as you take independent control of the rider and take the ultimate test of mettle. Dual controls let you tear it up with death-defying tricks and high-flying freestyle action. Fight for traction and dig up the track to leave your mark. Hone in your skills through havoc-laden environments that come alive, creating ever-changing conditions.
Rush through raging rivers, slash though swampy everglades, and blaze through desert dunes as the terrain gets altered with every turn. Gain on your opponents lap after lap as you force the competition to carve new race lines, but beware, they can do the same to you.

Product Features

Test Your Reflexes
  • Dual controls allow you to control your rider as you power your vehicle independently.
  • Lean in to take tighter turns and higher jumps.
  • Think fast and wrestle your ride back from the verge of catastrophe.
Leave Your Mark
  • Real-time deformation continuously changes the track beneath you with every lap. Dig up the track and force the competition to carve a new race line.
  • Rush through raging rivers, slash though swampy everglades, and blaze through desert dunes as the terrain gets altered with every turn.
  • New terrain engine provides unprecedented driving surface detail never achieved in any other racing game.
Pull Off The Sickest Tricks
  • Dual controls let you tear it up with death-defying tricks and high-flying freestyle action.
  • Intuitive gestures in the Reflex Trick System let you push the limits to pull off the most extreme stunts ever.
  • Impress the judges. Increase your score. Emerge victorious in MotoX Freestyle.
Vehicles
  • Customize and tune the fiercest MX bikes and ATVs.
  • Choose from a variety of vehicles including Sport Buggies, Sport Trucks and UTV’s.
  • Flaunt your latest battle scars as truck body panels shatter and break away.
READ MORE

System Requirements

    • OS: Windows XP, Vista, Windows 7
    • Processor: Athlon 64 Processor 3800+ 2.4Ghz or better, Intel Pentium 4 530 3.0 Ghz Processor or better
    • Memory: 1GB XP, 2GB Vista/Windows 7
    • Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce 8000 series 256MB graphics card or better, ATI Radeon HD 2000 series 256MB graphics card or better
    • DirectX®: Latest 9.0c or better
    • Hard Drive: 8GB
    • Sound: Windows compatible sound card
READ MORE

RockstarCRO
156 products in account
124 reviews
Recommended
1.4 hrs on record
Posted: August 7
I'm conflicted to whether I really like it, or simply like it. Trust me, there's a big different.

MX vs. ATV Reflex is an off road racing and stunt game made for enthusiasts. I like the game, but little elements make me dislike it for not being better.

The absolute first thing that bugged me was the first person view. I couldn't see the bike or handlebars until I was in motion or if the bike was bumping upwards. Going from MotoGP 13 first person to this is just absolutely horrible. It feels decently adequate but the feel of having absolute full control isn't here. To be in full control, one needs to play in third person view to completely enjoy the game and character stunt movements. My only other complaint is the steering. MotoGP isn't perfect in it's steering, but it feels quite realistic when doing so. Here, it feels choppy or sort of skippy. It doesn't interfere so much in the game play but for people looking for exact motor bike steering, it isn't exactly here. It feels like the game is caught between being an arcade game and a simulation game, such as it's unable to decide which one to be. Either than that, the game is quite fun and provides for some serious fun. The different game modes include free-roam, race, and stunt. What makes this game quite unique though is that the right analog stick looks after the body movements while the left deals with the bike. This is a fantastic addition to the game as turns can be done on a dime if done right. This also helps rotate the bike in the air while doing stunts. Jumps are pretty rewarding and landings are decently accurate. There is a system that exists within the game where if your character loses his balance, you have to use the right thumb stick and push it in a direction multiple times to avoid falling off the bike. Another system to be appreciated as it keeps you on your toes.

Graphics are absolutely fantastic as tire, bike and body marks on the ground are amazingly drawn. The terrain deformation is astounding. Sounds are pretty decent but bike sounds more or less sound the same.

For future MX vs ATV games, the jerky feeling of the steering needs to be addressed. It doesn't feel real at all sometimes especially when making landings.

Overall a pretty good game worth buying especially if on sale. Sucks it doesn't have local co-op but it does have multiplayer if it matters.

RATING : 7.35/10

ScreenShots :

Me, getting bumped by a truck, which is also a part of this race

The crash system is fun to abuse...

...especially when the computers start going at it

Terrain deformation occurs even when the riders hit the ground

More unnecessary carnage

The body impact physics are on point

Minimalistic first person view. Definitely not a fan of it
